item.title: dickens_signalman
item.description: The Haunting of the Derridean ‘Spectre’ in “The Signalman” by Charles Dickens This essay was written during my study of the Ghosts, Haunting and Spectrality module at UEA.

item.title: Empathy and Literariness in Charles Darwin's *On the Origin of Species*
item.description: This essay was written during my study of the Victorian Writing module at UEA. “Reading The Origin [of Species] is an act which involves you in a narrative experience.

item.title: Man Vs. Nature
item.description: Man Vs. Nature: Romantic Perspectives on Humans and Nature in both William Blake’s “Spring” and John Clare’s “Crows in Spring” This essay was written during my study of the Romanticism 1780-1840 module at UEA.

item.title: The_uncanny
item.description: On the Move: Exploring the Agency of the Uncanny [ Unheimlich ] in H. G. Wells’ “The Red Room”
